main event: A military observer in Newport News, Virginia spotted a bright, round object that was reflecting sunlight and moving in an erratic pattern in the sky on August 15, 1965.
interesting points: The object appeared star-like and was estimated to be between 2.5 and 4.5 stellar magnitudes in brightness.
The object was observed to change course multiple times, with each change in course appearing to increase the object's brightness.
The observer was familiar with astronomy and stated that the appearance of the additional object was not compatible with his knowledge of astronomical phenomena.
The object suddenly disappeared towards the north after being observed for approximately 45-90 seconds.
The weather was clear with 7 miles of visibility at the time of the sighting.
sighted object: a bright, round object reflecting sunlight
